meta.title: Write texts to communicate ideas and information
meta.purpose: Learners credited with this unit standard are able to write meaningful texts for different purposes and audiences, and use written language conventions to support communication.

grade_descriptors.N: Evidence does not meet all required Performance Criteria.
grade_descriptors.A: All Performance Criteria across every outcome are met.

outcomes.description: Write meaningful texts for different purposes and audiences.

performance_criteria.description: Select and use content that is appropriate to purpose and audience.
Use text structures in ways that are appropriate to purpose and audience.
Make language choices that are appropriate to purpose and audience.
Write text that demonstrates sufficient technical accuracy to communicate meaning, without intrusive errors in spelling, punctuation, or grammar.

outcomes.description: Use written language conventions to support communication.

performance_criteria.description: Construct a variety of complete sentences.
Use grammatical conventions within sentences and paragraphs with sufficient technical accuracy to communicate meaning.
Use and spell everyday high frequency vocabulary with technical accuracy.
Make simple changes to improve text coherence and the organisation of the content.

omis.description: Content is relevant and suited to both the stated purpose and intended audience.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Include at least one concrete idea, fact, or descriptive detail that supports the topic/purpose. ✗ Generic filler, restating the prompt, or unrelated anecdotes do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: Our time at camp felt like it went as fast as our soaring arrows flying towards the big red target.
First, we can understand more about people that come from other countries and their cultures.

omis.description: Text structure (organisation, sequencing, paragraphing) matches the communicative purpose.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Logical organisation (e.g., clear intro‑body‑conclusion, or sign‑posted points). ✗ Random order, missing structural elements, or single long paragraph do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: appropriate introduction (name, reason), body, conclusion
First…, Second…, Finally… signposts guide reader.

omis.description: Vocabulary choices are precise and fit the purpose and audience.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Use specific or vivid words that enhance meaning. ✗ Overly informal slang in formal texts or vague words like “stuff/things” do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: soaring arrows
freakishly high rock

omis.description: Register and sentence construction match the intended context.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Consistent formal/informal register as required; sentence style suits reader expectations. ✗ Sudden shifts in formality or sentence fragments do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: I couldn’t find the words to thank you enough.
Have you experienced a circumstance that you travelled to a country and you lost your way?

omis.description: Spelling, punctuation, and grammar are technically accurate with no intrusive errors.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Minor slips acceptable if meaning stays clear; no pattern of intrusive errors. ✗ Frequent misspellings, tense shifts, or missing punctuation that obscures meaning do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: although it was freezing cold, nature's very own lazy river was my personal favourite activity.
that will be treasured forever

omis.description: Uses simple, compound, and complex sentences correctly.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Evidence of at least one accurate simple, compound, and complex sentence. ✗ Lists of phrases or repetitive simple sentences do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: I am most proud of myself.
Although it was freezing cold, nature's very own lazy river was my personal favourite activity.

omis.description: Applies punctuation (capital letters, full stops, question marks) correctly to support meaning.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Correct sentence‑ending and internal punctuation throughout. ✗ Random capitals, missing full stops, or absent question marks where needed do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: Dear Principal,
Have you experienced a circumstance that you travelled to a country and you lost your way?

omis.description: Grammar within sentences and paragraphs is accurate (tense, subject‑verb agreement, pronoun reference, word form).
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Consistent tense and agreement; correct pronoun reference and word forms. ✗ Tense shifts, “have you experience”‑type errors, or mismatched pronouns do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: my name is
we can understand more about people that come from other countries

omis.description: Everyday high‑frequency vocabulary is spelled correctly.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Words from Essential Spelling List / first 2000 NGSL spelled accurately. ✗ Phonetic misspellings like “lisson” or “expierience” do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: because
family

omis.description: Revises text to improve coherence and logical organisation.
omis.detection_hint: ✓ Evidence of edits that clarify flow (e.g., adding connectors, regrouping ideas). ✗ Surface edits (one word swap) without clearer idea links do NOT count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: So thanks again for giving me and all of my classmates a memory that will be treasured forever.
In conclusion, learning more than one language is benefit for understanding different cultures and communicating with foreigner
